STATIONS.name: Smith Machine
STATIONS.notes: High stability, fixed bar path. Great for beginners and consistent tension.

STATIONS.name: Back Upper Pulley (either back station)
STATIONS.notes: Constant tension. Use for pulldowns, face pulls, pushdowns, crunches.

STATIONS.name: Back Lower Pulley (station with lower pulley)
STATIONS.notes: Constant tension. Use for rows, curls, pull-throughs, wrist work.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Pair of single D-handles
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Unlocks single-arm presses/rows/curls/raises; best for symmetry and shoulder comfort.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Triceps rope
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Best for pushdowns, face pulls, overhead extensions.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Short straight bar (cable bar)
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Curls, pushdowns, wrist curls, straight-arm pulldowns.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Ankle strap
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Glute kickbacks, hip abduction/adduction, standing ham curls.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Ab strap (cable crunch strap)
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: More comfortable heavy cable crunches than holding a bar.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Lat bar (you already have)
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Wide/standard pulldown and straight-arm pulldown patterns.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: EZ/angled lat bar (you already have)
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: Comfort grip variations; good for underhand/angled pulldowns.

RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.name: Dip belt or strong assistance band
RECOMMENDED_ATTACHMENTS.why: If you want assisted pull-ups using the Smith bar setup.
